ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: LING 624 01 is a class that, in addition to introducing mathematical concepts, teaches students how to reason formally and how to apply this reasoning to linguistic analyses. I would definitely recommend LING 624 01 to another student because it definitely introduces important foundations for linguistic study and is very well-taught.

This is a fast-paced introduction to mathematical topics that are important for linguistics. With emphasis on "fast-paced". This is an excellent and very well taught course, and is highly recommended for those who are not afraid of writing mathematical proofs or are willing to lose the fear.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I had very limited mathematical background before I took this class and it really helped me understand mathematical concepts how they are relevant to and important for linguistic analysis.
